I have thoroughly enjoyed the product for almost two months and I will list my experiences with it.<br /><br />First and foremost, I looked at the ingredients of the product and made sure that they were there for the correct reasons. With ingredients like Vitamin C, Hyaluronic Acid, Rosehip Oil, Argan Oil, Jojoba oil, and Vitamin E, I knew I couldn't go wrong. Each of those ingredients are hard to find in a product by themselves, much less all combined, so you know you are getting top quality. The texture is in between thick and watery, so in order words, just right. The smell is great and citrus like. It's also convenient to use because of the dropper. The effects are the best part and basically your skin will become extremely soft and plump. This is not a one time thing, as I noticed that over continued use, my skin has become much more soft than before. It works for really oily skin too, which I have. Overall, the product has proved it's worth and I am very satisfied. I'm in the process of ordering more and am considering purchasing their other products too.

I've been using this serum for about a month now, and as of about a week ago I can say I see consistent change. Of course when I first used it there were immediate results, but those tend to go away. But for the past week I have not seen a blemish, and my skin is very smooth to the touch. I have also been told by my coworkers that I look glow-y. The serum is an orange color, and smells citrus-y, which should not be unexpected. It's very pleasant. The instruction say to use twice per day, but I prefer to use it just at night, and use an H2O hydrator during the day. There is really nothing negative to say about this product; it is well priced and effective, at least for my needs. I will definitely continue purchasing.

About me: I'm 30, pretty good skin although prone to hormonal breakouts once a month, only oily on my nose, I don't go tanning - only general sun exposure, only starting to get some fine lines around my eyes (I notice it, no one else does). My skin routine is pretty simple, I either use regular soap, baby wash (cheap, gentle makeup remover), or L'Oreal &#34;Go 360 Clean, Ideal Clean&#34; to wash and follow up with a bit of moisturizer in my T zone. I do get a bit of skin caking in the crease of my nostrils and in the corners of my mouth and under my lip.<br /><br />To start, it smells good to me, like freshly peeled oranges. It feels quite refreshing to put on after a shower. It's not sticky and goes on smoothly.<br /><br />I've used this several times. I can't really attest to its anti aging properties, but it definitely hydrates. My skin feels great, it felt softer even after the first use, and the feeling lasts at least two days for me. I have another extremely expensive natural anti aging serum and it dries my skin out so badly. This does the opposite - I actually use it in place of a moisturizer. I have noticed an improvement in healing my rogue pimples. I've had an old pimple bump (or whatever you call them) on my chin for weeks that has finally begun to go away. It also helps in healing any redness from my picking. I also haven't noticed any hormonal breakouts this month, could be a coincidence, but I've noticed a general improvement with my complexion overall.<br /><br />When I apply it under my makeup, I noticed it helps in giving it an airbrushed finish (I do use a brush to apply foundation and a primer). It's even helped keep it looking nicer for longer. Before, I noticed my foundation would settle into the creases under my eyes (I've always had these creases, even as a teen) and just generally look gross to me after several hours, but this has seemed to help that issue.<br /><br />I haven't really noticed a reduction in the size of my pores. A couple of them seem smaller, but honestly, your pores serve a purpose. You need them, so I don't expect that to change, nor do I want it to really.<br /><br />Would I buy this again? Yes.   177. Well sometimes it happens, stress and illness have played havoc and your skin looks as worn out as you feel. The good news is that your skin can feel better and firmer if you treat yourself to a Vitamin C serum. Drop by drop the serum delivers your tired complexion an energy boost, refreshing and tightening, while giving it much needed nutrients.<br /><br />&#34;Serums contain up to three times as many nutrients as creams and in the highest possible concentration,&#34; says Eric Gooris, director of Clairns Laboratories in Paris. That is why they are sometimes three times as expensive as creams, but that's also because they work faster and penetrate deeper. &#34;The reason is that serums have very small molecules and lipophilic - fat friendly - therefore they are able to penetrate the lipid layout of the skin and penetrate better into the depths, &#34; explains the dermatologist Dr. Martina Troebinger from Dermatologikum Berlin. The recommended duration depends on the nature of the serum form, of it's consistency compatibility and of course the individual skin condition. Results can be seen from 2 to 4 weeks after gently massaging the serum into the skin.<br /><br />HYDRATE SKIN<br /><br />After age 30, the skin's own moisture is depleted. The water content of the skin becomes out of balance and skin becomes dry and wrinkles multiply. Now add sun exposure, wind, extreme heat or cold and the skin aging process just enters warp speed. Moisture binding products are needed that supply the skin with hydration. Often this is done with the addition of Hyaluronic Acid and beneficial oils.<br /><br />LESS PIGMENT SPOTS<br /><br />Aging, UV radiation or hormonal changes often show up as brown skin discoloration (sun spots or age spots), an indication that too much melamine pigment is produced by the skin. Fruit acids such as vitamin C help to regulate Melanin production and leave the complexion looking more even.<br /><br />WRINKLE PREVENTION<br /><br />To prevent wrinkles or smooth out existing ones, products with firming polypeptides and vitamin A, E and C have shown great results. InstaNatural’s Vitamin C Serum formula is packed with nutrients that you will not find elsewhere. It contains 20% Vitamin C, Hyaluronic Acid, Ferulic Acid and Vitamin E. Rosehip Oil, Sea Buckthorn Oil, Plant Stem Cells, Argan Oil and more work together to nourish your skin while restoring its health and beauty.<br /><br />InstaNatural’s Advanced Formula Vitamin C Serum is produced in small batches to ensure quality and freshness. There is even a Manufacturer Guarantee – InstaNatural is proud to back their products with a 100% Satisfaction Guarantee Policy, no matter where you buy the products. If you are not completely happy with your purchase, please contact InstaNatural for a refund – no questions asked.<br /><br />Vitamin C to rebuilt Skin Collagen<br /><br />Collagen is the foundation for good skin and it provides the necessary strength and resilience that we attribute to young looking skin. Vitamin C is essential for producing a stable collagen scaffold. Where deep wrinkles are seen in the skin, the collagen scaffold was damaged due to excessive stress over time. Nourishing the skin with vitamin C helps to minimize and reduce the damage.<br /><br /> If you have been reading my blog, you know how much I love Vitamin C serums. Since I have started using them my skin has never looked better. Insta Natural Advanced Formula Vitamin C Serum comes in a 1 Fl oz , blue bottle and is applied after you cleanse your face with a dropper. A small amount of serum goes a long way and I usually massage it over my face and neck area in circular motions. The serum has a very faint smell, perhaps from the Rosehip Oil, which is very pleasant. There is a slight sensation of skin pores tightening. and afterwards my skin feels nicely hydrated. My fine lines around the eyes are almost gone and there are no blemishes. My age spots are sadly still there, but they have not gotten any worse. I love the way the serum feels on my skin and I will continue to use vitamin C to nourish and hydrate my face. I have used several of Insta Natural products now and have been very happy with all of them.<br /><br />MY RESULTS<br /><br />If you have been reading my blog, you know how much I love Vitamin C serums. I would recommend this as part of someone's daily facial routine, as I use it every day. I was getting a tiny line by my mouth (whaa??? NO!) and it's gone now.   313. So far, so good! I bought this Vitamin C serum a couple weeks ago as a boost to my normal skincare regimen. I am turning 40 this summer, I have been eating &#34;clean&#34; for 3 years, and I care about easy, affordable, and effective skin care. I don't have a lot of money to be throwing around on trial-and-error skin care, nor a lot of time either.<br /><br />I had been noticing a significant reduction in my skin hydration recently, especially coming out of a Minnesota winter, but by April, my skin usually snaps back well enough. This year, Mother Nature reminded me of her presence, so I decided to add to my skin care.<br /><br />I used Vitamin C serum by Avon in my twenties. Now, granted, I used that formula 15 years ago, but I remember hating its stickiness, gloppiness, and hint of orange color. It honestly was the color, consistency, and stickiness of honey. Maybe that's why I avoided C serums afterward, even though I really like most other Avon products.<br /><br />The InstaNatural Vitamin C serum is NOT sticky, not gloppy, and not medicinal smelling. Its smell is lightly citrus, and the serum absorbs quickly. It does not just &#34;dry&#34; on the face; it soaks in.<br /><br />This serum is also not watery. Some investigation led me to choose InstaNatural over a few competitors due to others' use of water to give &#34;twice the serum for half the price&#34; or some such claim. It is 1 ounce and not watered down. A drop from the stopper sits on my finger until I decide to apply it.<br /><br />A little does go a long way, like other reviewers have said. I use it everywhere on my face except the lashlines (no need for accidental contact with my eye), my neck, decollete, and left hand (see below).<br /><br />I also like that the ingredients are organic and that I do not need a separate serum for the hyaluronic acid. The percentages for each key ingredient are standard for proper skin care.<br /><br />The test: I have used the back-of-the-hand test to see if my $20 and my time were worth this serum. Every night and morning, I apply this serum to the left hand and none on the right. I then apply Intensive Care moisture repair lotion on both hands.<br /><br />Week One tests indicate, yes, this serum is working. The back of my left hand (tester) is already softer than the other with noticeable recovery when tugged. The back of my right hand (control) still looks like a Minnesotan's hand in late spring.<br /><br />I will check back with updates on occasion. I am encouraged by what I see so far.

I use 4 drops on my face – if more the subsequent moisturiser ‘balls’. I like the expiry data printed clearly on the bottle. I had problems with using a dropper rather than a pump, I think I knocked the vanity unit with the dropper too hard – as the end was broken slightly after a few days. I live in New Zealand, and Instanatural doesn’t send directly to NZ – so order via Amazon. Ordering a single bottle is expensive, so I ordered 4 1-oz serum bottles, the shipping was over $25. So, each bottle costs over $6 more than for US customers. Bottom line – I didn’t notice any difference changing to Instanatural serums except that I now seem to have fine ‘smokers lines’. I still want to economise on serums. i-herb shipping is $8 for a large order, so if getting supplements anyway, other products basically have free shipping – so will investigate what products are on offer.

  415. InstaNatural Vitamin C Serum is almost clear and has a sweet smell with a hint of citrus and just the slightest whiff of spice. The new, improved formula has a slightly more viscous consistency, which makes it easier to apply to the skin. It comes in a dark amber glass bottle to protect it from the light, with a dropper cap for easy dispensing.<br /><br />Inside the bottle is blend of helpful ingredients such as aloe, vitamin C (L-ascorbic acid) 20%, vitamin E (tocopherol), MSM, hyaluronic acid, sodium PCA, and jojoba oil, in an herbal infusion. The formula improves the appearance of the skin by increasing hydration, reducing the effect of fine wrinkles, and removing dead skin cells. It has an immediate soothing effect on dry, flakey skin. I have also found that regular application seems to minimize the appearance of facial pores.<br /><br />There are also many well-designed scientific studies that demonstrate that topical vitamin C significantly reverses the damage done to the skin by the sun when used for several months. Of course, regular application over a period of many weeks or months is necessary to see the promised benefits--it is not an instant cure for damaged skin.<br /><br />It is best applied after a bath or shower. The solution is slightly thick but is not at all oily and just a few drops massaged into the skin immediately causes a slight tingly sensation because it is so concentrated. Apply a moisturizer a few minutes later to prevent drying the skin. Storing it in the refrigerator makes it feel even more refreshing and also keeps it safe from light and heat.<br /><br />InstaNatural provided vitamin C serum for evaluation and review.

  436. As a product tester I compare dozens of skin care products, and I've arrived at a list of key considerations from fragrance to long-term results. I hope these are helpful to you!<br />~ Fragrance: Citrusy. No added/artificial fragrance.<br />~ Color and texture: This is a thick liquid the color of orange juice.<br />~ Feel during application: Smooth and slippery, feels somewhat like a moisturizer.<br />~ Feel after absorption: Moisturized and soft. No film or barely perceptible film.<br />~ Is it best for a certain skin type?: It works well on my oily, sensitive skin, and should be fine for others.<br />~ Is it tested on animals?: No.<br />~ Packaging: 1oz blue glass bottle with squeeze dropper top.<br />~ Immediate cosmetic effects:* Lighter and smoother looking, with a reduction in very fine lines.<br />~ Potential long-term effectiveness:* Excellent. Packed full of active ingredients for healing, improving skin elasticity, reducing inflammation, and fighting signs of aging.<br /><br />*Know the difference between cosmetic and long-term effects: Cosmetic effects are immediate and only present when the product has been applied recently - just like makeup. Long-term effects take longer to see and should remain when you stop using the product (but don't when you find something effective - your skin needs continuing support). The ideal product would be both cosmetically and long-term effective, but it's more realistic to expect a formula to tilt towards one or the other.<br /><br />I received this free or virtually so for product testing and review. I am under no obligation to provide a positive review and receive no incentives or rewards for doing so. My aim is to highlight features and drawbacks that I would want to know about as a buyer, not hype the product for the manufacturer. My remarks are sincere and my own.I would want to know about as a buyer, not hype the product for the manufacturer. My remarks are sincere and my own.

  678. Unlike other skin serums, Vitamin C serum is a natural way to produce collagen because of it's ascorbic acid. Collagen will increase your skins elasticity making it tighter, firmer and more plump - which means less of that sagging feeling. It is rich in anti-oxidants that repairs and revives the cells and give the skin a healthier younger appearance. It makes my skin have brighter glow and feel velvety soft. Did I mention you can see results after using the serum one week!<br /><br />The serum has a very watery texture but glides on like silk. It has a citrus aroma and absorbs very quickly into your skin. I use it all over my face and throat in the AM and PM. It can be used alone or underneath a moisturizer.<br /><br />Besides helping give your face a younger healthier new look, Vitamin C serum also helps your skin repair itself from damage such as scars, age or dark spots, sun damage and even expedite the healing of wounds and reduce inflammation.<br /><br />However, be advised that it does have a shelf life. Vitamin C serum should be clear and not yellowish. If it smells rancid or weird, it should also be thrown away. This means it has oxidized and has lost its effectiveness. A good Vitamin C Serum is sold in an amber bottle just like this one to extend its shelf life. Make sure to store it away from heat and sunlight and that the cap is tightly closed. If you like you can even store it in the refrigerator.<br /><br />Sample provided for review.

I don't get breakouts very often, but I do tend to get a few around &#34;that time of the month&#34;, and applying this serum seemed to have helped significantly. They were under control and gone within a day, as opposed to taking a week or so if left untreated.<br /><br />Vitamin E is a powerful antioxidant that protects and repairs your skin. It helps improve the look of your skin - evens out the tone, gets rid of red and brown spots, hydrates. In other words, it helps it look younger and firmer. It can also reduce sunburns from exposure to UVB.<br /><br />Sodium Ascorbyl Phosphate is a relatively new derivative of Vitamin C, it is considered a powerful antioxidant that is gentle on your skin and shouldn't cause any irritation. It can treat acne and stimulate collagen.<br /><br />I have been using this serum on daily basis for about a month now and my skin seems firmer, more hydrated and healthier-looking. I have been getting compliments about it on no-makup days, which happen more often now that I'm more confident and happy with the way my skin looks.<br /><br />The smell of the serum is quite strong and may be off-putting to some, but with so many wonderful ingredients it's really not a big price to pay.   783. It is my position that products purchased on amazon have two-fold ways of being evaluated. Vendors sell products and are reviewed for the quality of the product/item on sale and the manner in which they come across/engage (through shipping, customer service, and returns) to/with the buyer. Every vendor has the option to sell their product through amazon prime and choose either to stock their products with amazon (making amazon the seller) or ship it themselves, but with a fulfillment guarantee from amazon. So long as vendors will opt for the cheap way out, no matter how great their product or service, I will rate them at a tad bit more than 2.5 (50%) stars on the this rating scale.<br /><br />This is very good product &#34;for me&#34;. I researched and understood (as best I could), through Dr. Google, about my skin type, condition, and concerns. After which, I looked on amazon and read several reviews on more than one such product before using this one. I am not about to vouch that you drop years or that you loose wrinkles. However, I will confirm that if this product is used based on the vendors instructions with fidelity (twice a day), preceded and followed by other skin care practices, then the pores start getting a little tighter, and overall facial skin health is rejuvenated (looks hydrated, supple and fresh).<br /><br />I will add that I support this regimen with the manufacturer's phytoceramides (capsules) and, thus, cannot guarantee that either product alone produces the above results. I am satisfied with the combined treatment/regimen.

Not only does it contain active ingredients to help your skin renew itself like vitamin c and ferulic acid but it also contains ingredients to help soothe and moisturizer your skin for a longer period of time.<br /><br />Once you apply this serum on cleansed skin, it will absorb within a few minutes and leave your skin silky smooth without being greasy. You can then apply your moisturizer but I prefer to wait for a while. Since I have a lot of scars, I have to use this on every area on my face every night. 1 ounce has lasted me for almost 3 months which is ideal because any skincare product with vitamin c oxidizes so you will not be able to keep an open bottle for years. At most, you should use up an opened bottle within 6 months. If you have less areas to worry about, this will probably last for that amount.<br /><br />Since I've used this for a few months, I've had a slight change, mainly in the early stages of using it.   1083. I received the Insta Natural Vitamin C Serum for free for use and review. It came in a pretty blue glass bottle with an orange-reddish label. The liquid was a cloudy light orange color, thickish as opposed to watery. What was so tantalizing about it was the fragrant scent of oranges. I do not mean artificial candy orange, but pure orange like juice from a fresh squeezed orange. Tasting it was tempting, not obviously not an option! It was a pleasant surprise and made application more pleasing to the senses. The scent did not longer, so you did not smell like a vitamin C tablet all day. The liquid came out in a dropper format and it came out slowly enough so you could control the amount. It went on very smoothly and spread across the skin very nicely. It left a softness and did not have a sticky feeling. The nice part of this serum is that it is made of natural ingredients. including 20% Vitamin C which may account for the pleasant scent. Vitamin C is an antioxidant used to help repair the skin and to help avoid future damage. Other ingredients include: Hyaluronic Acid (moisturizes skin), Tea Tree Oil (a skin soother), and Retinol (a pore de-clogger). It does not matter what type of skin you have (dry, oily, or combo) as this products is &#34;one size fits all.&#34; There was a noticeable difference in the diminishing of fine lines especially around my mouth and eyes. I felt as if my skin was more youthful. Everything you would want in a skin serum can be found in one bottle. I would highly recommend this product. #Instanatural
  1084. I've only used this serum for a few days and already feel and see a difference in my skin. I purchased this product based on ingredient's and reviews. I've used a Vitamin C serum in the past but it was oily and caused an irritation in my skin. This InstaNatural product is superb. The vitamin C content in this product is very good for the skin and I believe some customers are unaware of that. I found this tidbit to back up this products effectiveness. Sodium Ascorbyl Phosphate is a newer, more stable form of Vitamin C. It reduces the damage caused by free radicals, stimulates the formation of collagen, and reduces dryness and the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles. Research has shown that sodium ascorbyl phosphate also reverses DNA damage and may reduce sunburn and skin damage resulting from excess exposure to ultraviolet B radiation. I'm 51 and most people think I'm much younger. I use Tretinoin .025 at night and a Niacinamide serum 5% in the morning and now recently added this Vitamin C serum in the morning. I'd really like to try InstaNatural Niacinamide 5% Serum as it has better ingredient's then the one I currently use. I'll post back in about a month.

I've tried more serums than I can recall and this one for me has no discernible scent, absorbs more quickly than most, and seems to be competitively priced (not the suggested or list price, but the cost of under twenty dollars). All indications are that the product is fresh and my only complaint is that because it is absorbed almost immediately upon application to the skin, it's necessary to drop the serum directly onto a section of the face and rub it in before applying to another section. I've been using it for just under a month and have enjoyed the taught feel I experience after application, just prior to adding my sunscreen and moisturizer. I have not observed anything extraordinary, but then my sensitive skin has had no adverse reaction whatsoever.

I know that I get frustrated with many products because I run out of the product right around the same time I start seeing results. That shouldn't be a problem with this serum.<br /><br />This serum isn't at all greasy and doesn't feel oily on your skin even though it contains many oils. It left my skin feeling soft, smooth, firm and looking MUCH healthier. I've noticed my skin tone is more even, my skin is much smoother, and I've had less breakouts. I've been using this after using the Instanatural Vitamin C toner (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00NLKAVL4) and I'd definitely recommend using these together. They compliment each other well and seem to really work together to make your skin healthier.<br /><br />I will definitely be keeping this serum in my daily skincare routine. It has replaced several other products that I used to use because it is more of an all-in-one rather than being for one specific problem.<br /><br />This product was provided to me for testing and review purposes, but I would never endorse something that I didn't believe was worthy of it and I would never post an opinion that wasn't my own.
  1282. I have used Estée Lauder Advance Night Repair for about two years now. I was getting low and just couldn't see spending that kind of money on it any longer. It was the least expensive, with the best reviews.<br /><br />The first time I used it I was a little worried because it is so thin (I'm used the thick stuff.) It goes on easy, and dissolves quickly. I didn't notice a weird smell like other reviewers have said and I tend to have an overly sensitive sense of smell.<br />I have always had pretty good skin, aside from a blemish or two and the once a month full blown pimple I get right before I start (sorry.) I'd get tiny little white bumps on my cheeks that come and go, but not anymore.<br /><br />I'm going to try their face moisturizer and Rose Hip oil next. The price is right and quality is outstanding. I would highly recommend.

  1314. I have been using this for about two weeks now, and am starting to see results. Nothing drastic, but there is a definite brightening of my skin. I bought it mainly to hopefully diminish the old crone lines around my mouth, and it will take longer for that, I think!<br /><br />It took awhile for me to get the hang of the proper amount to use for my skin. At first I was using two drops night and day as advised on the label. Then I changed to three drops per application. Then four. I work outside, and I noticed that my skin was feeling drier than normal despite using moisturizer over the serum. So this week I decided to use it only at night, reducing the amount to three drops, with argan oil and rosehip oil over it. I strongly recommend this - moisturizing oils enhance this beautifully and I wake up with dewy skin. Something about being outside in the sun for extended periods of time causes dryness with this serum, so if you work outdoors and/or have very sensitive skin as I do, I would only use this at night. Also be careful with it around the eyes. Just a minuscule amount is needed there.<br /><br />I feel that this has the same effects as exfoliation with brightened skin as a bonus. It does not cause my pores to become enlarged as some exfoliators do, so that is a definite bonus! I would cleanse well, use a good moisturizing toner (InstaNatural's rose water works great with this), apply the serum, then the oils over that. I love their argan oil over it as well as rosehip oil. Just remember not to get excited and use too much...my face became a bit red when I was using four drops at a time. Two to three drops are all I need to get a nice, healthy bright complexion!

  1327. My comments are based upon comparison to the previous version which was not &#34;Advanced Formula Vitamin C Serum. ~The former version was a clear, freely adsorbing thinner liquid which was light on skin, relatively little aroma, and soaked into the skin immediately leaving no sticky residue. I like it because of its ease of use, it was clear leaving no film after drying, and it allowed me to apply other products over it immediately. Most important I found the Original version to be more effective. I did see more improvement in dark spots and other pigmented areas around my face, neck and hands. ~This products--the Advanced Formula--is of thicker, sticky consistency that is cloudy and orange colored. It did not adsorb freely into my skin after cleansing. It dried slower and also formed somewhat of a barrier that I personally found annoying because other normally applied products such as moisturizing serum, moisturizer, and perhaps foundation makeup seemed to float on top and not penetrate the Vit C Serum layer. Also if during the day I was exposed to humid outdoor air or warmth due to my own activity, my skin would not breathe and perspiration caused the return of the sticky feeling as if the Vit. C. serum had just been applied, tI requires more product usage because of its thick consistency. I don't experience improvement of my dark spots or other imperfections like with the Original formula. . ~This experience is relevant to my skin type, my exposure to heat and humidity of course. However, I was extremely happy with the former product and hope that Insta-Natural would offer that as alternative again. It was unfortunate that the product formula was changed and no warning was given on their Amazon customers. When I received the Orange colored product I thought some mistake had been made though I had clicked on &#34;order again&#34; and expected the product to be identical. After researching I found that the name had changed to &#34;Avanced Formula&#34;. Ordered a 3rd of what I thought to be the original formula only to receive another advanced bottle. ~The company is very good about replacements or refunds--once the product has been tried of course; so I'm not concerned other than: I wanted the Original Formula that I ordered and please don't make product changes without clearly stating it in your Amazon Ad. I do not appreciate becoming a test market for new products without a choice. The fine print on the bottle label in the ad is not shopper friendly and it was not easy to see that the name changed to Advanced Formula. ~I will not order again and look for a clear, thinner product . Thank you.

  1343. I've used many vitamin C serums in the past and have always been very impressed with the power of vitamin C. I got this in the mail today and was even scared to use it since the highest percentage of vitamin C I have used has been 18% and it seriously irritated my skin. I was so nervous that I used a tiny cotton swab to apply it. What happened? Nothing. No tingling, no stinging. Nothing. I got more daring and applied even more to my skin. I felt nothing. Just like applying water on my face. You'd think this would be a good thing, right? Wrong. Although I had hoped for it not to irritate my skin as bad as other serums, I certainly didn't expect no tingling at all. I looked at the ingredients and noticed that there is no actual vitamin C (L-Ascorbic Acid). Instead, there is a synthetically derived version of vitamin C: Sodium ascorbyl phosphate (SAP). I am seriously disappointed. Studies have repeatedly shown L-Ascorbic Acid as having the most effective antioxidant properties as it is the purest form of vitamin C. I won't be using this and I'll be ordering another serum, paying more attention to the form of vitamin C.

  1418. so after spending lots of precious time and frustration sorting through the reviews of the free loaders who got the product for free to test, I was a bit concerned. You can always tell those reviews, they go on and on, about how many ounces in the bottle, listing ingredients and what they are suppose to do.... Here is my fave: this serum smells delicious,.... and on and on never really being specific about the concrete actual personal changes in their skin. SO after reading all the reviews and I must say: this company would benefit avoiding these free loaders, because so many of these views made me wonder if this product has any value, not to mention all the precious time going through those. SO I think I vented, now on to the product. It works. I have been using it for one week, just about. I do have a few small bumps from my skin detoxing since I started using it, but that only lets me work the product works!!!. Day one I loved it., I jus turned 42 and I am noticing things about my skin that I never thought I would. ANd it's like your skin changes over night. I am into skin, in the beauty industry and have spent a considerable amount of time and money on sooo many products during the course of countless years. Many of the products that did amazing for me no longer suffice.<br />it is imperative to moisturize the skin after applying the serum and for women in their 40's it recommend a deep moisturizer, depending on the skin type. The first thing I loved was the texture and absorbtion and fragrance.. It left me wanting to apply more of it to my skin. I did have some small bumps on my skin, but that just let me know the product works. About a week into it, and i realize it is early to tell, my pores are reduced like all the way, leaving my skin texture smoother, also I see clarity and an even tone now, I had discoloration around my chin and side of my face since my20's and that is gone, in specific yellowing around the mouth. That is such a big deal, .. I have a dark spot nothing major but def obvious and that has faded. Below my chin I have a faint line that has been there since my late 20's and that is gone, and that is huge to me, because for the life of me I would have to do multiple treatments to make that go away for like 24 hours, and last but not least the lines and a bit of puffines that I began to notice rt after my42nd BD, are gone. I still have some fine lines on my forehead and it has only been a week, I do not use botox or fillers so I have those on my forehead but seeing the results so far am hoping I can loose those. I do have to say that this does lighten your skin so if you do not want that then beware of this product. OK the only thing I could add is a pump bottle so that the product does not get oxidized every time you open the bottle. I also bought the eye serum and it is equally wonderful<br />sorry for the wordy review and venting i hope this helps some people out thererk spot nothing major but def obvious and that has faded. I suggest waiting a few minutes after you wash your face to use this product. The first time I used it, it felt tingly, due to my open pores, right after a warm face wash. But there is no tingling if you wait just a few minutes after you cleanse your face. I love using this at night.
